body: Hi Mostapha, Thank you so much for taking time to reply. I tried using the same tool placing the ies file  in the C drive here is what the bat file attached says: **SET RAYPATH=.;c:\radiance\lib ****PATH=c:\radiance\bin\;$PATH** **cd C:\Radiance\Tests ****ies2rad -o arthur_0.7 -m 0.7 CDM-i_25W_10deg.ies** It does create the rad file but the output is still empty as shown below. I hope you can help again.  Many thanks, Arthur [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/zMJxnqMJKq0DLJzkfHQN5b0J1WChw8n6GW4H-iOPDJbt4YSkjLFOEXnvqYxNm5YsQP9etweMEIM7ojave65jbalAZR69jV69/Canvasat112405.png)
